definitions: To record the time of one's departure from work using a time clock.
To strike someone until they are unconscious or defeated.
To eject from an aircraft using an ejection seat.
To create a hole or shape by pressing or hitting a tool through a surface.
examples: I need to punch out at five.
The pilot had to punch out over the ocean.
He threatened to punch out the bully.
Punch out the shapes from the cardboard.
